alert.note: Alert for Orange County Coastal (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued December 27 at 9:01PM PST until January 01 at 2:00AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM THURSDAY TO 2 AM PST MONDAY... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM THURSDAY TO 2 AM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, minor coastal flooding expected. For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 7 to 12 feet with highest surf in northern Orange County. * WHERE...Orange County Coastal Areas. * WHEN...From 8 AM Thursday to 2 AM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of lots, parks, and roads with only isolated road closures expected. Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Locations most susceptible to flooding include Seal Beach, Sunset Beach, and Newport Beach. Here are the projected highest tides of each day for Newport Beach: Thursday, December 28: 6.1 feet at 909 AM. Friday, December 29: 5.8 feet at 944 AM. Saturday, December 30: 5.4 feet at 1020 AM. Sunday, December 31: 4.9 feet at 1058 AM.
info.instruction: Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions.
